That seems strange to me: 500 is not a valid percentile: percentiles and between 0 and 100. 500 voxels is something like 5% of the brain, so I would have expected 5 here. In addition, the valid argument of SelectPercentile is "percentile" and not "k". Are you sure that this example actually runs OK?
title: (None, '', u'examples/02_decoding/plot_haxby_anova_svm.py')

text: You need to change SelectKBest in commented line to SelectPercentile.
title: (None, '', u'examples/02_decoding/plot_haxby_anova_svm.py')

text: As stated in the issue, this sentence needs to be edited "We set the number of features to be selected to 500" and replaced with "When doing full-brain analysis, it is better to use SelectPercentile, keeping 5% of voxels (because it is independent of the resolution of the data)."
title: (None, '', u'examples/02_decoding/plot_haxby_anova_svm.py')

text: It was specified as 10% in the issue, so do we keep ``percentile =10`` in ````SelectPercentile````?
title: (None, '', u'examples/02_decoding/plot_haxby_anova_svm.py')

text:
5% would be good enough I guess as we are selecting good features in the brain with 5%.

We wait and see if others are asked to change to 10%. Otherwise 5% is good enough.
